TITLE.P: Homelessnes - First Stop/Supported Accommodation with Outreach Support

SHORT_DESCR.P: South Lanarkshire Council are seeking to tender for the provision and management of the following services:
Lot 1 — Supported accommodation with outreach support
Lot 2 — Outreach housing support for households with children.
Lot 3 — Supported and first stop emergency accommodation for individuals and families.

TITLE.P: Supported Accommodation for single people/couples with complex needs with Outreach Housing Support

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a Housing Support service, with Landlord / Housing Management responsibility, to a 31 bedded supported accommodation facility for single people/couples with complex and or multiple support needs in the East Kilbride area. In addition, you will provide outreach support for up to 50 individuals with complex support needs in the community at any one time, across the South Lanarkshire area.

The supported accommodation will be operational 24 hours per day / 7 days per week and will be staffed to operate to full capacity at all times, with at least 2 members of staff on duty in the supported accommodation at any time. The service will also provide 24/7 telephone support to service users receiving outreach support.

TITLE.P: Outreach Housing Support for Households with children

SHORT_DESCR.P: The service will work with families with complex needs who are affected by homelessness, who are either currently homeless, resettling from homelessness or at risk of homelessness.

The service will provide a holistic, client focused floating Housing Support Service that meets the Support needs of families affected by homelessness and who have complex needs. The project will work with 30 families at any one time.

TITLE.P: Supported and First Stop Emergency Accommodation for individuals and families

SHORT_DESCR.P: To provide a housing support service, with Landlord / housing management responsibility, to a 30 bedded supported and first stop emergency accommodation, across 3 standalone bases:-.
1. Supported accommodation for single people/couples in the Blantyre area.
2. Supported and emergency first stop accommodation for single people/couples in the Hamilton area.
3. Emergency first stop accommodation for homeless households with children in the East Kilbride area.
The Accommodations will be operational 24 hours per day/7 days per week and will be staffed to operate to full capacity at all times.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: ESPD Question 4B.4 Economic and financial standing.
The Council will use the following ratios to evaluate a bidders financial status:
Profitability – this is taken as profit after tax but before dividends and minority interests. If a company makes a profit then it is a pass for this ratio;
Liquidity – this is calculated as current assets less stock and work in progress, divided by current liabilities. If the answer is greater than or equal to one then it is a pass for this ratio.

Gearing – this is calculated as the total external secured borrowing (short term and long term) divided by shareholder funds expressed as a percentage. If the answer is less than or equal to 100 % it is considered a pass for this ratio.
Bidders must provide the name and value of each of the 3 ratios within their response to ESPD question 4B.4.
The Council requires bidders to pass 2 out of the 3 financial ratios above.

Where 2 out of the 3 ratios cannot be met, the Council may take the undernoted into consideration when assessing financial viability and the risk to the Council, providing that the Bidder can supply evidence to substantiate any of the mitigating criteria when requested to do so. The following list is not exhaustive and other criteria may be considered where proposed by a bidder as mitigating factors:
Would the bidder have passed the checks if prior year accounts had been used?
Were any of the poor appraisal outcomes "marginal"?
Does the bidder operate in a market which, traditionally, requires lower liquidity or higher debt finance?
Does the bidder have sufficient reserves to sustain losses for a number of years?
Does the bidder have a healthy cashflow?
Is the bidder profitable enough to finance the interest on its debt?
Is most of the bidder's debt owed to group companies?
Is the bidder's debt due to be repaid over a number of years, and affordable?
Have the bidder's results been adversely affected by "one off costs" and / or "one off accounting treatments"?
Do the bidder's auditors (where applicable) consider it to be a "going concern"?
Do Keynote (where applicable) consider the bidder to be a "going concern"?
Will the bidder provide a parent company guarantee?
Is the bidder the single supplier/source of the goods/works/services in the marketplace?
The Council will request submission of and assess the bidders financial accounts, and may use Keynote or similar financial verification systems to validate the information provided.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The Council requires bidders to pass 2 out of the 3 financial ratios above.

INFO_ADD.P: Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in regulation 58 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.

ESPD Questions 3A – 3C have been identified as mandatory exclusion grounds and ESPD Questions 3D have been identified as discretionary exclusion grounds. All the exclusion grounds will be assessed on a pass/fail basis. For the mandatory exclusion grounds a bid will be excluded where the bidder fails to provide either a positive response or to provide details to the satisfaction of the Council of the self cleansing measures undertaken. For the discretionary exclusion grounds a bid may be excluded where the bidder fails to provide either a positive response or if the Council is not satisfied as to the self cleansing measures undertaken.
